reference.author: SM Fullerton
reference.unstructured:
Fullerton SM, Lee SS-J : Secondary use and the governance of de-identified data: lessons from the human genome diversity panel. BMC Med Ethics 2011; 12: 6, Mention of biobank consent appears in the Declaration of Helsinki for the first time in its 2013 iteration at paragraph 32: “For medical research using identifiable human material or data, such as research on material or data contained in biobanks or similar repositories, physicians must seek informed consent for its collection, storage and/or reuse.” World Medical Association Declaration of Helsinki: Ethical Principles for Medical Research Involving Human Subjects. World Medical Association 2013. Archived at 
                    http://jama.jamanetwork.com/article.aspx?articleid=1760318
                    
                  .
